revised_title: Effects of Uniaxial Stress and Electric Fields on Localized Vibrational Modes of H
tldr: The authors investigated the effects of uniaxial stress and electric fields on the localized vibrational modes of hydrogen ions in crystals. They found that these external perturbations can split the energy levels of the ions and cause additional electric dipole transitions. The study provides insights into the behavior of hydrogen ions in crystals and can help improve our understanding of their electronic energy levels and vibrational spectra.
